review_blob: Bottle, batch #83.  Slightly cloudy gold in color.  Medium head.  Apple aroma.  Persistent finish a nice surprise to the relatively light body.  Agree with the alcohol comments below.  Like a yeastier better-balanced Tripel, myself.
Bottle.  Cloudy pour, medium gold color.  Light head.  Orange and apricot aroma.   Strong floral ester and flavor.  Sweet, sour, bitter all well balanced.  Skinny, bubbly feel.

Bottle.  Light molasses color, sweet aroma, medium head.  Strong yet light malt flavor with definite caramel notes.  Mild body complements flavor very well.  Bubbly feel.  Surprisingly complex and refreshing on a summer day post-work!
"Foret" branding.  Balanced sweet/sour, with nice bitterness.  Sweet and fruity aroma, complemented by yeasty sourness and spicey light-body.  Refreshing!
0.4 L draft at Loreley, in NYC.  My first Kolsch, so not much to compare to.  No lingering head, crisp grain, a little dry and tasty.
On tap at Loreley, in NYC.  More golden than the Jevers I had the same trip; I thought it tasty.
